title: How to Make Baked Pumpkin Pudding

steps.headline: Grease or line a pudding container.
Add the pumpkin purée, 1/2 cup sugar, chopped nuts and raisins or sultanas to the mixing bowl.
Mix the spices ingredients together in a small bowl.
Melt the butter in the saucepan over a low heat.
Add the flour and stir until slightly browned.
Pour half of the roux into the pumpkin purée mix.
Pour the mixture into the pudding container or casserole dish.
Spread the other half of the roux over the top of the pudding mixture.
steps.description: If wished, add a few more nuts and raisins/sultanas to the top and a sprinkling of nutmeg.

steps.headline: Place in the oven.
steps.description: Bake for 40 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the pudding comes out clean.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: The pudding can be served warm or it can be allowed to cool down and served cold. Accompany with whipped cream or ice cream.

text: Preparation Grease or line a pudding container.  Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC.  Mixing the Ingredients Add the pumpkin purée, 1/2 cup sugar, chopped nuts and raisins or sultanas to the mixing bowl. Mix to combine well. Mix the spices ingredients together in a small bowl.  Making the Roux Melt the butter in the saucepan over a low heat.  Add the flour and stir until slightly browned. Do not allow to brown. Add the milk gradually. Stir until it thickens. Add the mixed spice ingredients. Stir through evenly. Remove from the heat.  Baking the Pumpkin Pudding Pour half of the roux into the pumpkin purée mix. Stir to combine well. Pour the mixture into the pudding container or casserole dish.  Spread the other half of the roux over the top of the pudding mixture. If wished, add a few more nuts and raisins/sultanas to the top and a sprinkling of nutmeg. Place in the oven. Bake for 40 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the pudding comes out clean. Serve. The pudding can be served warm or it can be allowed to cool down and served cold. Accompany with whipped cream or ice cream.
